I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

forall n m : nat, multZ (pos n) (neg m) = neg (n * m + (n + m))

multZ = fun x1 x2 : Z => match x1 with | OZ => OZ | pos n => multpos x2 n | neg n => multneg x2 n end : Z -> Z -> Z
Inductive Z : Set := OZ : Z | pos : nat -> Z | neg : nat -> Z Arguments pos _%nat_scope Arguments neg _%nat_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
tech_mult_pos_posZ : forall n m : nat, multZ (pos n) (pos m) = pos (n * m + (n + m))
tech_mult_neg_negZ : forall n m : nat, multZ (neg n) (neg m) = pos (n * m + (n + m))
tech_add_neg_negZ : forall n m : nat, addZ (neg n) (neg m) = neg (S (n + m))
tech_add_pos_posZ : forall n m : nat, addZ (pos n) (pos m) = pos (S (n + m))
Nat.mul_add_distr_r : forall n m p : nat, (n + m) * p = n * p + m * p

Nat.even_add_mul_2 : forall n m : nat, Nat.even (n + 2 * m) = Nat.even n
Nat.add_succ_l : forall n m : nat, S n + m = S (n + m)
Nat.add_succ_r : forall n m : nat, n + S m = S (n + m)
tech_opp_pos_negZ : forall n : nat, oppZ (pos n) = neg n /\ oppZ (neg n) = pos n
Nat.even_add_even : forall n m : nat, Nat.Even m -> Nat.even (n + m) = Nat.even n
Nat.odd_add_even : forall n m : nat, Nat.Even m -> Nat.odd (n + m) = Nat.odd n
multZ_eq3 : forall (n1 : nat) (n : Z), multZ (pos (S n1)) n = addZ (multZ (pos n1) n) n
multZ_eq5 : forall (n1 : nat) (n : Z), multZ (neg (S n1)) n = addZ (multZ (neg n1) n) (oppZ n)
Nat.mul_sub_distr_l : forall n m p : nat, p * (n - m) = p * n - p * m
Nat.even_mul : forall n m : nat, Nat.even (n * m) = (Nat.even n || Nat.even m)%bool
Nat.odd_add_mul_even : forall n m p : nat, Nat.Even m -> Nat.odd (n + m * p) = Nat.odd n
Nat.even_add_mul_even : forall n m p : nat, Nat.Even m -> Nat.even (n + m * p) = Nat.even n
Nat.add_shuffle3 : forall n m p : nat, n + (m + p) = m + (n + p)
minus_n_Sm : forall n m : nat, m < n -> Init.Nat.pred (n - m) = n - S m
tech_add_pos_negZ : forall n : nat, addZ (pos n) (neg n) = OZ
tech_add_neg_posZ : forall n : nat, addZ (neg n) (pos n) = OZ
Nat.ones_add : forall n m : nat, Nat.ones (m + n) = 2 ^ m * Nat.ones n + Nat.ones m
technical_lemma : forall y m : nat, S (y * m + (y + m) + m) = S y * m + (S y + m)
Nat.gcd_add_mult_diag_r : forall n m p : nat, Nat.gcd n (m + p * n) = Nat.gcd n m
Nat.mul_succ_l : forall n m : nat, S n * m = n * m + m
Nat.mul_succ_r : forall n m : nat, n * S m = n * m + n
Nat.mul_add_distr_l : forall n m p : nat, n * (m + p) = n * m + n * p
multZ_commutativity = fun x y : Z => Z_ind (fun x0 : Z => multZ x0 y = multZ y x0) (eq_ind_r (fun z : Z => multZ OZ y = z) eq_refl (mult_OZ y)) (fun n : nat => nat_ind (fun n0 : nat => multZ (pos n0) y = multZ y (pos n0)) (eq_sym (mult_IZ y)) (fun (y0 : nat) (H : multZ (pos y0) y = multZ y (pos y0)) => eq_ind_r (fun z : Z => z = multZ y (pos (S y0))) (eq_ind_r (fun z : Z => addZ z y = multZ y (pos (S y0))) (eq_ind (multZ y (succZ (pos y0))) (fun z : Z => z = multZ y (pos (S y0))) eq_refl (addZ (multZ y (pos y0)) y) (mult_succZ_r y (pos y0))) H) (tech_mult_posZ y0...
Fin.t_ind : forall P : forall n : nat, Fin.t n -> Prop, (forall n : nat, P (S n) Fin.F1) -> (forall (n : nat) (t : Fin.t n), P n t -> P (S n) (Fin.FS t)) -> forall (n : nat) (t : Fin.t n), P n t
mult_acc_aux : forall n m p : nat, m + n * p = mult_acc m p n
Nat.tail_addmul_spec : forall r n m : nat, Nat.tail_addmul r n m = r + n * m
tech_pred_posZ : forall n : nat, 0 < n -> predZ (pos n) = pos (Init.Nat.pred n)
Nat.mul_lt_pred : forall p q n m : nat, S p = q -> p * n < p * m < -> q * n + m < q * m + n
Nat.add_comm : forall n m : nat, n + m = m + n
Nat.add_shuffle0 : forall n m p : nat, n + m + p = n + p + m
Nat.add_cancel_r : forall n m p : nat, n + p = m + p < -> n = m
Nat.add_cancel_l : forall n m p : nat, p + n = p + m < -> n = m
multZ_eq2 : forall n : Z, multZ (pos 0) n = n
Nat.add_assoc : forall n m p : nat, n + (m + p) = n + m + p

induction n.
